meanings.definition: The plural of felly, which is the outer rim of a wheel, to which the spokes are attached.
meanings.sent1: The fellies of the wheel help support the structure.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic replaced the old fellies with new ones on the wagon.
meanings.sent3: The fellies of the wheel decided to have a picnic to relax.
meanings.sent4: The fellies of the wheel worked together like a team to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The shiny fellies gleamed in the sunlight as the wheel turned.

meanings.definition: A group of people who share a common interest or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The fellies in the book club enjoyed discussing their favorite stories.
meanings.sent2: The fellies at the charity event raised funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent3: The fellies at the party danced all night long.
meanings.sent4: The fellies in the office collaborated on a project to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The fellies in the hiking group explored new trails together.
